front.div:
Anatomy of the human ear.
Right tympanic membrane as seen through a speculum.
front.note:
This is an old revision of this page, as edited by Jmrowland (talk | contribs) at 19:04, 11 October
2010. It may differ significantly from the current revision (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eardrum)
.
(diff) ← Previous revision | Latest revision (diff) | Newer revision → (diff)
front.div:
The tympanic membrane, or eardrum, is a thin membrane that separates the external ear from the middle
ear. Its function is to transmit sound from the air to the ossicles inside the middle ear. The malleus bone
bridges the gap between the eardrum and the other ossicles. Rupture or perforation of the eardrum can lead
to conductive hearing loss.
